commentary_on_process:
To solve the problem, I subtracted 1980 from 2008 to get the number of years between the two dates. This gave me the answer of 28 years. 

To solve the problem better, I could have used a calculator or a spreadsheet program to subtract the two dates and get the answer more quickly and accurately. Additionally, I could have double-checked my answer to ensure that I did not make any errors in my calculations.
final_answer:
The new maximum price of gold was reached 28 years after 1980. 

Answer: 28
problem_text:
Context:
After the August 15, 1971 Nixon shock, the price began to greatly increase, and between 1968 and 2000 the price of gold ranged widely, from a high of $850 per troy ounce ($27.33/g) on January 21, 1980, to a low of $252.90 per troy ounce ($8.13/g) on June 21, 1999 (London Gold Fixing). Prices increased rapidly from 2001, but the 1980 high was not exceeded until January 3, 2008, when a new maximum of $865.35 per troy weight was set. Another record price was set on March 17, 2008, at $1023.50 per troy ounce ($32.91/g).

Question:
How many years after 1980 was there a new maximum price of gold?
